page.title: 09POPULATION OF FRILSHAM
page.content: In 1921 the population of Frilsham was 233. In 1985 it is 240. There has been very little movement in or out of the area. Population is mostly concentrated in the village.{Young {people}tend to move out to find work and live elsewhere. There is some movement of retired{middle class} people who buy houses here and settle. There are usually 3 or 4 planning applications each year not a great deal of new building. There are all classes in the population. The{upper {and middle classes}live in houses such as Hawkridge House or in the larger ones. Some are{professional} people. They send their children to boarding schools. The bulk of people are{working class.}Their children tend to improve in status over the years. The{Berkshire dialect}is sadly dying out owing to radio, TV and education.
